name: La Quinta Inn & Suites Kennewick

reviews.text: We always enjoy staying at La Quinta as we travel. This one was no exception. Check in was quick and without drama, room clean, bed comfortable. Rooms are quite, with the exception of the refrigerator, which I have found in several of our La Quinta stays. Fortunately this one was easy to unplug. Breakfast was very adequate with biscuits and gravy, waffles bagels etc. Our dog enjoyed it as well and they provide clean up bags in the pet area. Will stay again.
reviews.title: Nice stay, dog friendly free breakfast

reviews.text: Really enjoyed my stay here. The hotel room was nice and the bed was super comfortable. The complimentary breakfast was pretty darn good. The only thing is I like hot eggs for breakfast and apparently they rotate days for their hot main dishes. When I was there it was biscuits and gravy and the biscuits were like rocks.
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.text: This is the winner for the cleanest hotel of all time.Very good customer service.Breakfast better than most.Good beds.Easy access.Don't be fooled by the neighbor hotel advertising cheaper rates.Liked it 5 stars maybe 6!
reviews.title: Clean Motel-Good Service

reviews.text: Stayed one night on our way to WSU. Hotel is located within quick access to freeways but was quiet. Room was very nice, updated and clean. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast had good variety and was adequate. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel.
reviews.title: Quiet and clean hotel stay
Incredible value, very nice hotel
reviews.text: This hotel is amazingly nice for the price and for the Tri-Cities area. We were just passing through the Tri-Cities on our way to Boise and this was our stop along the way because the location is perfect if just passing through toward/away from Oregon. Check in took about 30 seconds. The room was way larger than expected. We had two queen beds and there was still room for a desk and a comfortable chair with ottoman. Room was super clean. Breakfast was great, especially liked the blueberry waffles with strawberries and whipped cream, which I have not seen at a continental breakfast before. I also loved the actual temperature control in the room so you could actually set a temp that you wanted instead of just "cool" or "heat" and then living with it all night. And they had cookies fresh and waiting at the front desk as we arrived.

reviews.title: Very nice, newer hotel.
reviews.text: Found on the internet the night before, a very nice hotel. Was looking for higher end hotel but went with value. Ended up with both. Place has all the new furnishings and nice beds. Microwave, fridge, internet, and breakfast included. Friendly greeting that was sincere and helpful. I would choose this one first if in town again.

reviews.title: We will be back!
reviews.text: Super clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff, dinner snacks during the week, easy freeway access and a hot breakfast including strawberries and whipped cream for your waffles! Got an $80 internet rate during the summer - best value we have experienced in 30 hotel stays during the past 12 months while visiting 5 different states.

reviews.title: Lovely, New Hotel
reviews.text: Beautiful new hotel. The beds are very comfortable and rooms are quiet. Nice, big room with quiet a/c. The front staff was very friendly and helpful when we were looking for somewhere to have some appetizers and a beer after a long day of travel. The breakfast was disappointing. The only fresh fruit was a few, sad apples and oranges. Lots of starch.

reviews.title: Nice and Clean
reviews.text: First time staying at a La Quinta. Stayed one night in June 2013. Room was clean, spacious and the bed was comfy with great pillows. Front staff very friendly. Breakfast was really good, they even had doughnuts. Would definitely stay again.

We stopped in here for a one night stay on our way to Eugene, OR. The hotel is clean, the bed's very comfortable and the water pressure perfect. Very good value. And many convenience's nearby. Starbuck's across the street. We walked over to the nearby mexican fast food place which was pretty mediocre, but the yogurt place next door to that restaurant was terrific.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location
La Quinta is your Dog's best friend.
reviews.text: We look for LaQuintas wherever we travel. They are dog friendly; meaning that they do not charge a non-refundable fee or any fee for the "privilege" of staying with them. For that alone, they have all my business.

Each LaQuinta varies in age and décor. This one is a little newer on the outside, but a mixture of new and old in the interiors...especially the bathrooms. However, it was spotlessly clean and the linens were crisp and fresh.
reviews.title: Felt like home

reviews.text: Funky issues with how the heat/AC works, but finally figured it out.
reviews.title: Very adequate
2000mile road trip
reviews.text: Friendly, accommodating staff. Would stay here again...they love the doggies, so I love them.

reviews.title: A Nice Surprize
reviews.text: Superior front desk service, including good information about where we could get something to eat late at night that was close. Spotless room with crisp white linens. It was quiet at night and we slept very well. More healthy options in the breakfast buffet would be welcome, for example: plain yogurt and real oatmeal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights on a weekend trip to Tri-Cities with our dog. The front desk clerk was pleasant on check-in. Our room wasn't ready so she gave us a map and directions to the Visitor Center and the park. We drove to Columbia Park and spent some time walking around, which was a nice break for us and the dog after several hours in the car. When we returned they had upgraded us to a mini-suite, which was awesome. Room was spacious and clean and the furnishings were newer. Wireless internet access was easy and fast enough. I found the bed very comfortable for a hotel, my husband did not. There was a grassy pet area with bags for clean-up. The pool and hot tub area looked clean and well kept, though we did not try it due to the large number of families with children who took advantage of that area. The work out room was small, but adequate, and I did use the treadmill. The only negative is that the workout room is not air conditioned and was very hot. The breakfast buffet is pretty meh. The usual coffee, juice, doughnuts, bagels, make your own waffles, yogurt, cereal. Whatever hot entrée was offered was always gone when we got there, so can't comment on that. I thought the rooms were pretty quiet. We rarely heard our neighbors. The shower in the room above was very loud, otherwise it was hallway noise, and you can't blame the hotel for guest/parents/kids who are inconsiderate of where they are and yell/run/talk loud in a hotel hallway. Overall we had a great stay, with one concern. Somehow I demagnetized my husband's room card. We stopped at the front desk and asked for a new one, which the young man at the front desk issued without asking for any type of ID. While he was very pleasant, the lack of security left us a bit surprised. We would stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice clean hotel, dog friendly

reviews.text: Breakfast was terrible--limited choices and very poor quality. Fitness center was poorly furnished, not all the equipment worked and no one on site could fix it. Staff were very courteous and helpful, but management is obviously cutting corners and it shows. I haven't stayed at LQ for years and, unless there's no alternative, won't again anytime soon.
reviews.title: Now I know why I use Holiday Inn Express

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is really a great value, and was quite clean and tidy. The only weak point about it was the breakfast buffet. If you have the time and like good food, I recommend skipping the buffet and go to a restaurant for breakfast. We were pressed for time and ate at the buffet. Yes, they have waffles and sugary donuts and coffee. Also, there are some healthful choices, however, I am not a fan of refrigerated hard-boiled eggs, reconstituted egg omelets heated up in a microwave or orange juice that reminds me of Tang.
reviews.title: Great rooms, mediocre breakfast buffet

aka: La Quinta Inn And Suites Kennewick
